definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: I have acquired the newspaper-reading habit .
They are pushing newspapers in schools, hoping to get children used to reading them.
sentences.chinese: 他們將報紙投放到學校，希望小朋友們能讀報。

sentences.english: We whiled away the time at the airport reading newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 我們讀報消磨掉在機場候機的時光。

sentences.english: But it is not book reading. Or newspaper reading. It is screen reading.
sentences.chinese: 但這不叫讀書，也不算讀報，而應該叫瀏覽屏幕。

sentences.english: He took the rashers back to the bed and ate them while he read the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着火腿回到牀上，邊喫邊讀報。

sentences.english: Mr Ma likes reading newspapers, but his eyes are getting worse and worse.
sentences.chinese: 馬先死喜悲讀報，但是他眼睛越去越好。

sentences.english: "Ma Bin Newspaper Reading" represents a brand new style of hosting a TV program.
sentences.chinese: 《馬斌讀報》是一種全新的播音主持語體形式。

sentences.english: Also, when foreigners read the "shopping basket project" in the newspaper, they feel confused.
sentences.chinese: 還有，比如說讀報課，閱讀課上踫到“菜籃子工程”。

sentences.english: And for that, there's no better source than journalism. So, reading newspapers, and
sentences.chinese: 最好的來源莫過於新聞節目了。因此，讀報，

sentences.english: My experience, traveling or reading newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 我的經歷，旅遊或者讀報。

sentences.english: Do you read a newspaper everyday?
There are purely logistic discouragements to newspaper reading.
sentences.chinese: 有些純屬邏輯上的障礙，也不利於人們讀報。

sentences.english: But it is not book reading. Or newspaper reading.
sentences.chinese: 但這不叫讀書，也不算讀報，而應該叫瀏覽屏幕。

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
Yunhe county in Lishui 麗水|丽水[Li2 shui3], Zhejiang
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
